channel.title: iPad 3
channel.description:
Well I haven't seen any other topics and the release date looks to be only a day away so who is going to be getting one of these?
If all the rumours are true, hi resolution display, improved camera, quad core processor, etc... I will be buying one asap. Its to bad ASUS wasnt smart enough to release their android transformer prime hd at the same time because I definitely would have choosen that over the apple counterpart but it looks like they are forcing my hand on this one.
Thoughts on the iPad 3?

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:51, topic:435345”]I’m not sure I have ever said that either. But I’ll always buy it if I actually liked and wanted it after I had tried it. I have around £700 worth of purchases over the years on my iTunes account, when they make it as easy, and as inexpensive as they do on these mobile platforms, you’re just being cheap, there is no defence for it.

There is a kind of moral justification in pirating a £40 game as a demo to play for half an hour see if you wanted it, because the publisher didn’t provide a demo. There isn’t when you take the stance “don’t really want to pay for apps”. Because that is different than someone who always buys something if they actually use it.

You’re just being cheap. Quite a difference.[/quote]
when is being cheap a crime, i though all humans were lol

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’m not sure I have ever said that either. But I’ll always buy it if I actually liked and wanted it after I had tried it. I have around £700 worth of purchases over the years on my iTunes account, when they make it as easy, and as inexpensive as they do on these mobile platforms, you’re just being cheap, there is no defence for it.

There is a kind of moral justification in pirating a £40 game as a demo to play for half an hour see if you wanted it, because the publisher didn’t provide a demo. There isn’t when you take the stance “don’t really want to pay for apps”. Because that is different than someone who always buys something if they actually use it.

You’re just being cheap. Quite a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:49, topic:435345”][quote author=Niall link=topic=538064.msg3948322#msg3948322 date=1332084183]
I’m not going to try defending piracy so don’t take this the wrong way, but if someone pirates something and had no intention of paying for it, the developers aren’t necessarily out of pocket or “losing money” because of it
[/quote]

They’re out of pocket in the sense that they aren’t receiving money that is rightfully theirs. People invest time and money into creating these applications, if people just decided to use their stuff for free they’re seeing less return on those investments.

If you are completely disregarding all the investment that went into an application, and are deciding just to take and use this stuff without any moral or legal right to do so, you are a bit of a cunt. Especially when it’s so inexpensive.[/quote]

For some reason I don’t believe that you have never pirated any application or any movie ever.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Niall:

I’m not going to try defending piracy so don’t take this the wrong way, but if someone pirates something and had no intention of paying for it, the developers aren’t necessarily out of pocket or “losing money” because of it

They’re out of pocket in the sense that they aren’t receiving money that is rightfully theirs. People invest time and money into creating these applications, if people just decided to use their stuff for free they’re seeing less return on those investments.

If you are completely disregarding all the investment that went into an application, and are deciding just to take and use this stuff without any moral or legal right to do so, you are a bit of a cunt. Especially when it’s so inexpensive.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

zk04d4.jpg780×775

I’m not going to pay for an expensive app anyway unless I REALLY need it, IE I can get adobe cs5.5 for free but I would never buy it, I would just use gimp or another alternative, so there never going to get my money anyway. Anyways I’m not going to sit here and have a discussion on downloading paid apps for free, If paying for some and not paying for some makes you think of me as scum I’m probably not going to lose too much sleep.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

tL:

You’re leaving the developers out of pocket, regardless or not if you were going to buy it anyway

I’m not going to try defending piracy so don’t take this the wrong way, but if someone pirates something and had no intention of paying for it, the developers aren’t necessarily out of pocket or “losing money” because of it

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:42, topic:435345”][quote author=tL link=topic=538064.msg3947752#msg3947752 date=1332026095]
Spends $500 on an iPad.

Won’t pay for cheap applications.

Scum
[/quote]

Sure because $20-30 for an application is cheap

Especially the ones like amplitude where I paid 20 bucks and now they want me to pay another 15 bucks more to unlock the rest of app[/quote]

“don’t really want to pay for apps” You didn’t narrow it down to the expensive ones, the few that there are. Most of them are below $5. Doesn’t make it any better though, still scum. Your excuses don’t matter, you’re still taking something you do not have the right to take - using something you have not paid for, which you should be. You’re leaving the developers out of pocket, regardless or not if you were going to buy it anyway, it doesn’t matter - it’s pretty simple.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:

[/quote]

His point is still valid. Why pay for a new iPad when you can just steal one? Apply whatever reason you come up with to the apps.[/quote]
Piracy != stealing

Fuck off, tying to talk ethics like you have never EVER pirated a movie or downloaded a song illegally, im completely fine with paying $0.99 or even a couple dollars for an app but I’m not going to drop $400 dollars on 10 apps that have no refund policy, and amplitude with their irig worked like shit tonight so now I’m out 20 for that app.

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well they tried to tell me it was the RAM first, and told them that is not what the evidence pointed to, but I let them replace the RAM at their own cost (as I have the free three year warranty), only to then be proven right to the same guy, that it wasn’t the problem and then they replaced the entire motherboard (as the GPUs are soldered on, obviously).

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:36, topic:435345”]I have always avoided that sort of service, but if you own an Apple computer it is always just best to take it into an Apple store - it is much easier than having to send it off, because you can show it to them in person and they will do the repairs or replacements in the store. So I’ll be fair and say that aspect is good, it is just sometimes - they don’t always trust what you are telling them is wrong with it, but other times, like when I finally got someone who wasn’t a dick, listened to me, I demonstrated why I thought the problem I was having was down to a faulty GPU on my laptop, he listened to me - replaced the board and it was fine.

It still doesn’t do anything to dim the hatred I have for going in those places, because it was never that part of the store that was really that annoying, in fact, it is quite good.[/quote]
when you tlak to them, they’ve got like a set list of what they can do, so mostly what you say is irrelevant you just say its broken then they figure out what catergory it falls under to dtermine what they do

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I have always avoided that sort of service, but if you own an Apple computer it is always just best to take it into an Apple store - it is much easier than having to send it off, because you can show it to them in person and they will do the repairs or replacements in the store. So I’ll be fair and say that aspect is good, it is just sometimes - they don’t always trust what you are telling them is wrong with it, but other times, like when I finally got someone who wasn’t a dick, listened to me, I demonstrated why I thought the problem I was having was down to a faulty GPU on my laptop, he listened to me - replaced the board and it was fine.

It still doesn’t do anything to dim the hatred I have for going in those places, because it was never that part of the store that was really that annoying, in fact, it is quite good.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Hahahaha, can’t say I’ve ever been in one, I really want to go to the genius bar though now and ask them some silly questions. I assume this is similar to those “Geek Squad” things they have in some shopping centres.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Some people weirdly like that horrific experience of being at an Apple store. Worst places in the entire world, which is a shame, because having a place you can easily take your hardware to for a replacement or repair is good and has proved useful for me. It’s just stupidly overcrowded with dickheads checking facebook on the macs, and the “genius” bar being full of patronising twats.

Also, it is the hardest place in the world to actually buy something. You have to just hang around and look confused to get someone to take notice of you and take your order, then you still just hang around, because they thought actually having an area where you line up and pay for your shit would be too convenient for Apple.

FUCK EM

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You guys suck, my mate went to apple store at 9am, got out about 40 minutes later with an iPad3. Played with it briefly this afternoon, the screen is as good as they make it out to be in the pictures, compared it to a 3.5" smartphone screen and they are just as clear as each other.
I can confirm the face recognition recognises black people.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:31, topic:435345”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=538064.msg3946166#msg3946166 date=1331880537]
Its about 2am here and I drove my my local apple store, its the only one in the large city I live in, already people camping out hahaha. Im going to watch a movie and drive by at 4am
[/quote]

I can’t be the only one who thinks camping out anywhere for hardware is fairly pathetic, I mean really :|[/quote]

No its pathetic especially when they are so stupid that they don’t realize that they could have bought their iPads at midnight from any 24-hour Walmart, or they are such fanboys that they will ONLY buy their apple products from apple, but yeah drove by at 5am and was about 20-40 people, anyways mine is coming via ups today so I don’t have to deal with with the retards. Would be fun to just take my ipad when I get it and go to the massive line and be a dick.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad 3
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:27, topic:435345”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=538064.msg3944505#msg3944505 date=1331734339]

Im pretty excited for friday. Microsoft Office will be coming to the iPad soon so this will make this the perfect table for me to use at school and I just bought an iRig to use with my guitar and a jot pro for note taking and now I am waiting to see what case/keyboard combo I should get.


[/quote]Keep in mind that the sound quality on iRig will be pretty shite. I have a StealthPlug from IK Multimedia, and it’s pretty much the same story. While it’s great if you’re moving about a lot, for serious recording it’s not worthwhile.

Yeah I was looking at the reviews and I saw people where having problem with noise but it looks that can be fixed through changing some program options. I mainly just got it to play with since it was only ~25USD so I figured couldn’t go to wrong with it. If I get serious about it I will probably order an Apogee JAM in a couple months. Any other iPad accessories you guy recommend?[/quote]I’m picking up one of these soon http://www.native-instruments.com/#/en/products/guitar/guitar-rig-kontrol/

Read full topic

I don’t use any accessories other than the smart cover. Never felt any need.
